definition: towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: The main idea is the people are more important than the kings.
sentences.chinese: 民贵君轻，民心向背是儒家民本思想的主旨。

sentences.english: Yes, the people support or oppose the relationship to a team's operation and development.
sentences.chinese: 是的，民气的向背干系到一个团队的运行和生长。

sentences.english: Personnel selection and appointment relations public support and success or failure of the party's cause.
sentences.chinese: 选人用人，关系民心向背和党的事业的兴衰成败。

sentences.english: Your family tree may look quite different than you expected.
sentences.chinese: 你的族谱可能和你想象向背。

sentences.english: Success or failure of the plan depends on whether the people are for it or against it.
sentences.chinese: 人心向背是这个计画能不能实现的关键。

sentences.english: The popular will is the key to the moral rationality of ruling.
sentences.chinese: 人民群众的心理向背是执政道德合理性的根本之所在。

sentences.english: The fate of a political party's future ultimately depends on popular support.
sentences.chinese: 一个政党的前途命运，最终取决于人心向背。

definition: lit. crooked and straight/fig. right and wrong, good and evil
to ebb and rise/to decrease and then grow
lowering and raising of the head/(fig.) small move/pitch (position angle)
what is true and what is false/(to get to know) the real situation
